item.title: 经济学家称加拿大经济衰退已经开始，贸易战仍在继续
item.description: 据预测，随着失业率上升和出口因与美国的贸易战而下降，加拿大经济很可能处于衰退的早期阶段。【原文：Canada’s economy is likely in the early stages of a recession, according to forecasters, as unemployment rises and exports fall because of a trade war with the US.】

item.title: 特朗普关税威胁重燃增长担忧，美国收益率下滑
item.description: 周五，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普威胁征收新关税，再次引发了人们对美国经济受损的担忧，并引发股市大跌，国债收益率随之下降。【原文：Treasury yields declined Friday after President Donald Trump threatened new tariffs, reigniting concerns about damage to the US economy and sparking a stock-market selloff.】

item.title: 房价下跌，美国新房销量跃升至 2022 年以来最高点
item.description: 美国 4 月份的新房销售量意外上升，达到 2022 年 2 月以来的最高水平，这很可能得益于建筑商为缓解转售市场面临的负担能力挑战而推出的激励措施。【原文：US new-home sales rose unexpectedly in April to the highest level since February 2022, likely helped by builder incentives aimed at alleviating affordability challenges that have a firm grip on the resale market.】

item.title: 国际米兰希望通过媒体版权筹集私人债务
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士透露，国际米兰足球俱乐部（FC Internazionale Milano SpA）正在寻求在私人债务市场上为其由足球俱乐部赞助权和媒体权支持的高收益债券进行再融资。【原文：FC Internazionale Milano SpA is looking at private debt markets to refinance its high yield bonds backed by the football club’s sponsorship and media rights, said people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 泰晤士河面临新一轮奖金审查，急需解决财务问题
item.description: 泰晤士河水务公司的支出受到了英国一群立法者的新一轮审查，因为这家陷入困境的公用事业公司正急于理清其财务状况。【原文：Thames Water’s expenditure has come under fresh scrutiny from a group of UK lawmakers, as the beleaguered utility rushes to sort out its finances.】

item.title: 贝森特预计 90 天关税暂停期结束前将有交易宣布
item.description: 美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）表示，他预计在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普 4 月 2 日宣布的为期 90 天的 "互惠 "税率暂停期结束之前，将与其他国家宣布贸易协议。【原文：Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said he anticipates that trade deals will be announced with other nations ahead of the expiration of the 90-day pause on the steep “reciprocal” rates that President Donald Trump unveiled on April 2.】

item.title: 价值 270 亿美元的巴蒂财富继承人加入英国财富外流大军
item.description: 印度最富有家族之一的继承人是英国电信巨头英国电信集团公司（BT Group Plc）的第一大股东，由于英国对富裕居民增税，他已搬离英国。【原文：An heir from one of India’s richest families, the top shareholder in UK telecommunications giant BT Group Plc, has relocated from Britain amid tax hikes on the nation’s wealthy residents.】

item.title: 肉类生产商 JBS 称美国上市计划已获少数股东批准
item.description: 根据一份公司文件，JBS SA 的少数股东批准了一项重组计划，为这家全球最大的肉类生产商在纽约上市扫清了障碍。【原文：JBS SA’s minority shareholders approved a restructuring plan that clears the way for the listing of the world’s largest meat producer in New York, according to a company filing.】

item.title: 比特币期权显示牛市不屈不挠，未平仓合约创历史新高
item.description: 尽管比特币从创纪录的区域回落，但期权显示，交易者仍然极度看涨，未平仓合约达到了历史新高。【原文：Even though Bitcoin has retreated from record territory, options show that traders remain extremely bullish with open interest reaching an all-time high.】

item.title: 美国通胀和衰退预测因与中国贸易停战而放缓
item.description:
彭博社最新调查仍显示经济正步入低速增长阶段

Latest Bloomberg survey still suggests economy is shifting into a lower gear

】

item.title: 欧盟希望通过制裁北溪 2 号阻止俄罗斯天然气回流
item.description: 欧盟即将决定将连接德国和俄罗斯的北溪 2 号天然气管道纳入针对莫斯科的新制裁提案，因为不断有传言称，北溪 2 号天然气管道将恢复流动，而欧盟希望阻止这一流动。【原文：The European Union is nearing a decision to include the Nord Stream 2 gas pipelines linking Germany and Russia in a fresh proposal of sanctions against Moscow amid persistent rumors about reviving flows that the bloc wants to stop.】

item.title: CoreWeave 股价飙升，多头与空头针锋相对
item.description: 尽管投资者普遍担心债务水平上升、现金消耗速度以及对其提供的云计算服务的长期需求，CoreWeave 公司的股价仍然一路走高。【原文：CoreWeave Inc. shares have been on a tear as investors snap up the stock despite widespread concerns about elevated debt levels, the rate of cash-burn and the long-term demand for the cloud-computing services it provides.】

item.title: 加拿大 4 月零售销售再次增长，尽管关税战仍在继续
item.description: 加拿大消费者上个月继续消费，不畏关税战对其就业和财富的威胁。【原文：Canadian consumers kept on spending last month, defying a tariff war that threatens their employment and wealth.】

item.title: 加纳债务负担降至国际货币基金组织（IMF）阈值，提前实现 2028 年目标
item.description: 由于新政府减少了借贷，加纳的债务负担提前三年降至国际货币基金组织 30 亿美元计划要求的门槛。【原文：Ghana’s debt burden fell to a threshold required by the International Monetary Fund’s $3 billion program three years ahead of schedule, as the the new government curbed borrowing.】

item.title: 巴克莱建议转向尼日利亚短期美元债券
item.description: 巴克莱银行建议投资者远离尼日利亚期限较长的美元债券，并指出曲线中段的收益率现在看起来更具吸引力。【原文：Barclays is recommending investors shift away from Nigeria’s longer-dated dollar bonds, noting that yields in the mid-section of the curve now look more attractive.】

item.title: 特朗普威胁对苹果和欧盟征收关税，美国期货下跌
item.description: 周五上午，由于美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的威胁，投资者进入风险厌恶模式，华尔街情绪低落。【原文：Wall Street’s mood soured on Friday morning as threats from President Donald Trump put investors into risk-off mode.】

item.title: 兰德摆脱特朗普和预算案影响，以积极姿态结束本周工作
item.description: 对兰特来说，开始时充满风险的一周以积极的音符结束。【原文：A week that started fraught with risks for the rand is ending on a positive note for the South African currency.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长莱恩称美国物价上涨未必会波及欧洲
item.description: 欧洲中央银行首席经济学家菲利普-莱恩认为，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的关税政策所引发的美国通胀加快并不一定会波及欧元区。【原文：Faster US inflation triggered by President Donald Trump’s tariffs wouldn’t necessarily spill over into the euro zone, according to European Central Bank Chief Economist Philip Lane.】

item.title: 特朗普关税威胁助推降息押注，欧洲债券反弹
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普威胁从6月1日起对欧洲地区征收50%的关税后，欧洲债券反弹，这加剧了人们对决策者将不得不进一步降低利率以支持经济的押注。【原文：European bonds rallied after US President Donald Trump threatened to apply levies of 50% on the region starting June 1, fueling bets policymakers will have to lower interest rates further to support the economy.】

item.title: 特朗普威胁从 6 月起对欧盟商品征收 50% 关税
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普威胁从 6 月 1 日起对来自欧盟的商品征收 50%的关税，并称 "我们与他们的讨论毫无进展"。【原文：President Donald Trump threatened a 50% tariff on goods from the European Union starting on June 1, saying “our discussions with them are going nowhere.”】

item.title: 中国需求依然强劲，令大型天然气公司欢欣鼓舞
item.description:
今年的进口量有所下降，但有迹象表明，随着该国逐渐适应摇摆市场，情况正在好转。【原文：

Imports have fallen this year, but there are signs of improvement as the country adjusts to being a swing market.

】

item.title: 印度央行创纪录地支付 316 亿美元，为政府财政提供支持
item.description: 印度央行将向政府发放创纪录的红利，以加强财政支持，促进亚洲第三大经济体的增长。【原文：India’s central bank will give a record dividend to the government, shoring up finances to bolster growth in Asia’s third largest economy.】

item.title: 欧洲央行卡齐米尔贿赂案下周宣判
item.description: 欧洲中央银行管理委员会成员彼得-卡齐米尔受贿案预计将于下周宣判。【原文：The bribery trial of European Central Bank Governing Council member Peter Kazimir is expected to deliver a verdict next week.】

item.title: 欧盟同意恢复乌克兰贸易配额，战争仍在继续
item.description: 欧盟已同意恢复对从乌克兰进口的几种农产品的配额，这给乌克兰饱受战争创伤的经济带来了更大的挑战。【原文：The European Union has agreed to reinstate quotas on imports of several agricultural goods from Ukraine, adding to the challenges faced by its war-hit economy.】

item.title: 游说团体称尼日利亚制造商因外汇合同受到 "骚扰
item.description: 尼日利亚制造商称，他们因与央行签订的远期外汇合同未到期而受到贷款机构的 "骚扰"。【原文：Nigerian manufacturers say they’re being “harassed” by lenders over outstanding forward foreign exchange contracts with the central bank.】

item.title: 特朗普威胁：如果 iPhone 不是美国制造，将对苹果公司征收 25% 的关税
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普威胁说，如果苹果公司不在美国生产 iPhone，将对其征收至少 25% 的关税。【原文：President Donald Trump threatened Apple Inc. with a tariff of at least 25% if the tech company does not manufacture their iPhones in the US.】

item.title: 科技公司成功上市潮给硅谷初创企业带来希望
item.description: 欢迎收看 Tech In Depth，这是我们的每日时事通讯，由彭博社全球记者提供有关科技商业的报道和分析。今天，凯蒂-鲁夫（Katie Roof）和凯特-克拉克（Kate Clark）将报道硅谷科技初创公司最近在公开市场成功上市后的曙光。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Katie Roof and Kate Clark report on the light at the end of the tunnel for Silicon Valley tech startups after a few recent successful debuts in the public markets.】

item.title: 特朗普批评英国征收北海税阻碍钻井活动
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普批评了英国对北海石油和天然气征税的做法，称这种做法阻碍了钻探，提高了能源价格。【原文：US President Donald Trump criticized the UK’s approach to taxing North Sea oil and gas, saying it discouraged drilling and raised energy prices.】

item.title: 病态动物提醒世界粮食贸易的脆弱性
item.description: 蔫头耷脑的鸡或肉里钻出蛆虫的牛，这些都是扰乱全球贸易的疾病造成的影响。【原文：Lethargic chickens with swollen heads or cattle with maggots burrowing into their flesh — these are effects of diseases that have been disrupting global trade.】

item.title: 恢复美国工厂就业所需的 3 万亿美元资金
item.description: 我是马克-尼奎特，驻俄亥俄州哥伦布市的美国经济记者。今天我们关注的是美国制造业就业回流的问题。请将反馈意见和建议发送至 ecodaily@bloomberg.net。如果您还没有注册接收本新闻通讯，请点击这里。【原文：I’m Mark Niquette, a US economy reporter in Columbus, Ohio.
